Sure, here are some general tips on what to expect during an acupuncture session:

1. Your acupuncturist will ask you about your medical history, symptoms, and concerns. They may also examine your tongue and feel your pulse to diagnose your condition according to Traditional Chinese Medicine. 2. You will be asked to lie down on a comfortable table. The acupuncturist will then insert thin, sterile needles into specific points on your body based on their diagnosis. 3. You may feel a slight sensation like a pinch or a dull ache when the needles are inserted, but it should not be painful. If you experience discomfort, inform your acupuncturist immediately. 4. You will be left alone to relax with the needles in for about 20 to 40 minutes. During this time, you may feel a sense of calmness and relaxation. 5. After the session, your acupuncturist will remove the needles and may offer you some herbal remedies or other advice for self-care. It is crucial to communicate openly with your acupuncturist throughout the session and let them know if you experience any discomfort, so they can adjust the treatment as necessary.
